channel.title: Disk Full Error - Resize Disk Issue
channel.description:
Hi,
Thanks to the Whonix team for making this available, I've been using it for a few months and really hope it stays alive.
I have been running Whonix from a USB drive for a few months but during a recent Debian update to the Gateway I got a Disk Full Error and I was unable to use it anymore. I had a backup on another USB drive without all the backups and that was working and even without the latest updates I got the same error but from the Workstation. There is still plenty of space on the USB so I thought, is it the updates that are to big for the default Disk size set by Whonix?
I created a new installation and moved everything to a different USB3.0 drive that's 32GB and started to go through the Grow instructions here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Grow_Virtual_Harddisk
I created the VDI clone but when I try to resize it I get a message saying: Progress State: VBOX_E_NOT_SUPPORTED VBoxManage: error: Resize medium operation for this format is not implemented yet!
Can anyone help me resize the disks for the Gateway and Workstation and or shed some light as to why I was getting the Disk Full error?
Thanks

item.title: Disk Full Error - Resize Disk Issue
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It may be required to sort this out as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic
item.source: Disk Full Error - Resize Disk Issue

item.title: Disk Full Error - Resize Disk Issue
item.dc:creator: toxictoad
item.description:
Hi,

Thanks to the Whonix team for making this available, I’ve been using it for a few months and really hope it stays alive.

I have been running Whonix from a USB drive for a few months but during a recent Debian update to the Gateway I got a Disk Full Error and I was unable to use it anymore. I had a backup on another USB drive without all the backups and that was working and even without the latest updates I got the same error but from the Workstation. There is still plenty of space on the USB so I thought, is it the updates that are to big for the default Disk size set by Whonix?

I created a new installation and moved everything to a different USB3.0 drive that’s 32GB and started to go through the Grow instructions here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Grow_Virtual_Harddisk

I created the VDI clone but when I try to resize it I get a message saying: Progress State: VBOX_E_NOT_SUPPORTED
VBoxManage: error: Resize medium operation for this format is not implemented yet!

Can anyone help me resize the disks for the Gateway and Workstation and or shed some light as to why I was getting the Disk Full error?

Thanks
